info.title: JSON Ledger API
info.description: JSON-RPC interface for the Ledger API

methods.name: submitAndWait
methods.description: Submit a batch of commands and wait for the completion details

methods.name: submitAndWaitForTransaction
methods.description: Submit a batch of commands and wait for the transaction response

methods.name: submitAndWaitForReassignment
methods.description: Submit a batch of reassignment commands and wait for the reassignment response

methods.name: submitAndWaitForTransactionTree
methods.description: Submit a batch of commands and wait for the transaction trees response. Provided for backwards compatibility, it will be removed in the Canton version 3.5.0, use submitAndWaitForTransaction instead.

methods.name: getCompletions
methods.description:
Query completions list (blocking call)
Notice: This endpoint should be used for small results set.
When number of results exceeded node configuration limit (`http-list-max-elements-limit`)
there will be an error (`413 Content Too Large`) returned.
Increasing this limit may lead to performance issues and high memory consumption.
Consider using websockets (asyncapi) for better efficiency with larger results.

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of elements to return, this param is ignored if is bigger than server setting

params.name: streamIdleTimeoutMs
params.description: timeout to complete and send result if no new elements are received (for open ended streams)

methods.name: getVersion
methods.description: Get the version details of the participant node

methods.name: validateDar
methods.description: Validates a DAR for upgrade-compatibility against the current vetting state on the target synchronizer

methods.name: uploadDar
methods.description: Upload a DAR to the participant node

methods.name: listPackages
methods.description: List all packages uploaded on the participant node

methods.name: uploadPackage
methods.description: Upload a DAR to the participant node. Behaves the same as uploadDar. This method will be deprecated and removed in a future release.

methods.name: getPackage
methods.description: Download the package for the requested package-id

cantonPackageHash.description: Canton package hash (originally returned as Canton-Package-Hash header)

params.name: pageSize
params.description: maximum number of elements in a returned page

params.name: pageToken
params.description: token - to continue results from a given page, leave empty to start from the beginning of the list, obtain token from the result of previous page

methods.name: allocateParty
methods.description: Allocate a new party to the participant node

methods.name: generateExternalPartyTopology
methods.description: Generate a topology for an external party

methods.name: getActiveContracts
methods.description:
Query active contracts list (blocking call).
Querying active contracts is an expensive operation and if possible should not be repeated often.
Consider querying active contracts initially (for a given offset)
and then repeatedly call one of getUpdates methods to get subsequent modifications.
You can also use websockets to get updates with better performance.

Notice: This endpoint should be used for small results set.
When number of results exceeded node configuration limit (`http-list-max-elements-limit`)
there will be an error (`413 Content Too Large`) returned.
Increasing this limit may lead to performance issues and high memory consumption.
Consider using websockets (asyncapi) for better efficiency with larger results.

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of elements to return, this param is ignored if is bigger than server setting

params.name: streamIdleTimeoutMs
params.description: timeout to complete and send result if no new elements are received (for open ended streams)

methods.name: getUpdates
methods.description:
Query updates list (blocking call)
Notice: This endpoint should be used for small results set.
When number of results exceeded node configuration limit (`http-list-max-elements-limit`)
there will be an error (`413 Content Too Large`) returned.
Increasing this limit may lead to performance issues and high memory consumption.
Consider using websockets (asyncapi) for better efficiency with larger results.

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of elements to return, this param is ignored if is bigger than server setting

params.name: streamIdleTimeoutMs
params.description: timeout to complete and send result if no new elements are received (for open ended streams)

methods.name: getUpdateFlats
methods.description:
Query flat transactions update list (blocking call). Provided for backwards compatibility, it will be removed in the Canton version 3.5.0, use getUpdates instead.
Notice: This endpoint should be used for small results set.
When number of results exceeded node configuration limit (`http-list-max-elements-limit`)
there will be an error (`413 Content Too Large`) returned.
Increasing this limit may lead to performance issues and high memory consumption.
Consider using websockets (asyncapi) for better efficiency with larger results.

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of elements to return, this param is ignored if is bigger than server setting

params.name: streamIdleTimeoutMs
params.description: timeout to complete and send result if no new elements are received (for open ended streams)

methods.name: getUpdateTrees
methods.description:
Query update transactions tree list (blocking call). Provided for backwards compatibility, it will be removed in the Canton version 3.5.0, use getUpdates instead.
Notice: This endpoint should be used for small results set.
When number of results exceeded node configuration limit (`http-list-max-elements-limit`)
there will be an error (`413 Content Too Large`) returned.
Increasing this limit may lead to performance issues and high memory consumption.
Consider using websockets (asyncapi) for better efficiency with larger results.

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of elements to return, this param is ignored if is bigger than server setting

params.name: streamIdleTimeoutMs
params.description: timeout to complete and send result if no new elements are received (for open ended streams)

methods.name: getTransactionTreeByOffset
methods.description: Get transaction tree by offset. Provided for backwards compatibility, it will be removed in the Canton version 3.5.0, use getUpdateByOffset instead.

methods.name: getTransactionByOffset
methods.description: Get transaction by offset. Provided for backwards compatibility, it will be removed in the Canton version 3.5.0, use getUpdateByOffset instead.

methods.name: getTransactionById
methods.description: Get transaction by id. Provided for backwards compatibility, it will be removed in the Canton version 3.5.0, use getUpdateById instead.

methods.name: getTransactionTreeById
methods.description: Get transaction tree by id. Provided for backwards compatibility, it will be removed in the Canton version 3.5.0, use getUpdateById instead.

params.name: pageSize
params.description: maximum number of elements in a returned page

params.name: pageToken
params.description: token - to continue results from a given page, leave empty to start from the beginning of the list, obtain token from the result of previous page

methods.name: getAuthenticatedUser
methods.description: Get current user details (uses user for JWT).

methods.name: executeSubmissionAndWait
methods.description: Execute a signed transaction and wait for its completion

methods.name: executeSubmissionAndWaitForTransaction
methods.description: Execute a signed transaction and wait for the transaction response

methods.name: getPreferredPackageVersion
methods.description: Get the preferred package version for constructing a command submission

methods.name: getPreferredPackages
methods.description: Get the version of preferred packages for constructing a command submission

methods.name: getContractById
methods.description:
Looking up contract data by contract ID.
This endpoint is experimental / alpha, therefore no backwards compatibility is guaranteed.
This endpoint must not be used to look up contracts which entered the participant via party replication or repair service.

synchronizer.description:
TODO(#27670) support synchronizer aliases
Synchronizer ID on which to onboard the party
Required

onboardingTransactions.description:
TopologyTransactions to onboard the external party
Required

multiHashSignatures.description: Optional signatures of the combined hash of all onboarding_transactions

identityProviderId.description:
The id of the Identity Provider
Optional

partyIdHint.description:
A hint to the participant which party ID to allocate.
Optional

identityProviderId.description:
The id of the Identity Provider
Optional

synchronizerId.description:
The synchronizer, on which the party should be allocated.
Optional

userId.description:
The user who will get the act_as rights to the newly allocated party.
Optional

ArchivedEvent.title: ArchivedEvent
ArchivedEvent.description: Records that a contract has been archived, and choices may no longer be exercised on it.

Command.title: Command
Command.description: A command can either create a new contract or exercise a choice on an existing contract.

CreatedEvent.title: CreatedEvent
CreatedEvent.description: Records that a contract has been created, and choices may now be exercised on it.

JsCommands.title: JsCommands
JsCommands.description: A composite command that groups multiple commands together.
